text: [Music]
Hi, I'm Mark Damm with FuseForward. I'm
the president and CEO. We are an AWS
Advanced Technology partner. We've been
working with AWS since 2013.  I'm Wyatt
Mullin, Chief Revenue officer at Fuse
Forward. I'm responsible for sales
Marketing, and our partner programs. Over
the last 20 years, as both the systems
integrator and now as a cloud mana
service provider, we work with local
governments, municipalities, and we've
also worked with utility organizations
throughout Canada the United States and
over into the United Kingdom. One of the
problems that public sector agencies
have is having data in multiple silos
Silos from different applications and
different organizations, different IT
departments. What we're able to do is
bring together those various siloed data
and be able to provide IT staff with the
ability to get a single pane view of
their organization and how its
performing. Our challenge has been to go
through and try and build a private
cloud environment within AWS
We've done that. We now have built all
the different pieces that are required
in order to go through and run a private
enterprise workload in AWS, and meet all
the security and compliance requirements
of enterprise organizations. We have a
number of different customers, so we
usually use government agencies that are
working for public sector, municipal
local governments. Municipal and local
governments traditionally have always
said, “How do I go through and better
manage the costs of my workloads?” “Are
there opportunities to leverage the
Cloud?” “Can we have new applications be
deployed?” So, typically what we do is
we've provided them with the secure
landing zone to do that, and then we help
them go through and manage and migrate
their workloads from on-premise
environments, and give them cost savings
plus the security comfort by moving it
into the cloud. Our typical customer
profile is one who really wants to take
advantage of the benefits of the cloud
but maybe lack the skills in doing so. So
what we're able to do is deploy our
patented platform, as well as run it as a
managed service for our customers. We
work with a number of universities in
Canada as well where we're actually
researching new ways of doing
intelligent campus environments. The
universities we work with include
Ryerson University, York University
and Simon Fraser University. It’s a cross
Canada initiative. We basically have been
working with the different labs doing
things which include: Internet of things
Technologies, as well as using big data
analytics and ways to go through and
optimize cloud workloads. We use S3,
EC2,
we use Amazon Glacier. We use Amazon VPCs
and we use various other components
all throughout it.
[Music]
